meanings.definition: Making a contribution or helping to bring about a result.
meanings.sent1: She contributive to the charity event by donating clothes.
meanings.sent2: The team members contributive equally to the project's success.
meanings.sent3: His contributive efforts in the bake sale made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude was contributive to the team's morale.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's guidance was highly contributive to the students' learning.

meanings.definition: Providing something to a common purpose or fund.
meanings.sent1: The contributive of the community helped build the new playground.
meanings.sent2: Every member's contributive was essential for the event's success.
meanings.sent3: The contributive of snacks made the picnic even more enjoyable.
meanings.sent4: Her contributive of time to the cause was greatly appreciated.
meanings.sent5: The financial contributive of the company supported many local initiatives.

meanings.sent1: The contributive role of teamwork cannot be underestimated.
meanings.sent2: His contributive presence at the meeting brought new ideas.
